Indonesia Ikut Kejuaraan Dunia MMA Amatir 2019 di Bahrain
06 Nov 2019, 16:30 by Tempo.co, Ariandono
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Sukses menaungi pertandingan MMA Nasional terbesar di Indonesia yaitu One Pride MMA sejak 2016, kini Komite Olahraga Beladiri Indonesia (KOBI) semakin melebarkan sayapnya.
Bulan ini, KOBI akan mengirim timnas atlet amatir MMA Indonesia bertanding di kejuaraan MMA amatir dunia “2019 IMMAF – WMMAA Unified World Championships Amateur MMA”.
Kejuaraan tersebut akan berlangsung 11 – 16 November 2019 di Khalifa Sport City, Isa Town, Manama, Bahrain.
Kejuaraan MMA amatir dunia ini diselenggarakan oleh International Mixed Martial Arts Federation (IMMAF). IMMAF merupakan federasi MMA amatir pertama dan satu-satunya di dunia yang didirikan di Stockholm, Swedia pada 29 Februari 2012.
Selanjutnya, KOBI sebagai anggota aktif dan representative IMMAF di Indonesia, untuk diketahui pada setiap negara hanya ada satu federasi yang terdaftar di IMMAF.
Pada tanggal 23 Juni 2019 KOBI telah melakukan proses seleksi nasional atlet MMA kategori atlet amatir di Elite Club Epicentrum Jakarta. Sebanyak 20 atlet MMA dari beberapa sasana besar di bawah naungan KOBI di seluruh Indonesia ikut serta dalam proses seleksi nasional ini.
Dari proses seleksi terpilih 10 atlet MMA terbaik yang telah diberi pembekalan dalam Pemusatan Latihan MMA Nasional di Bali MMA Academy selama tiga bulan sejak Agustus 2019 sampai Oktober 2019.
“KOBI mengirimkan lima atlet amatir terbaik Nasional untuk mengikuti kejuaraan MMA amatir dunia di Bahrain. Hal ini sejalan dengan salah satu misi KOBI yaitu bekerja sama dengan organisasi MMA Internasional untuk menunjukan kehebatan para petarung Indonesia,” ujar Ardi Bakrie, Ketua umum KOBI.
Setelah melalui Pemusatan Latihan MMA Nasional, KOBI telah memilih lima atlet berkualitas yang akan diberangkatkan untuk mengikuti kejuaraan MMA amatir dunia di Bahrain. Lima atlet tersebut adalah Budi Setiawan (kelas Senior Fly weight), Rendi Anjar Kusuma (kelas Senior Bantam weight), Edi Erlangga (kelas Senior Bantam weight), Toby Prasetya (kelas Junior Light weight) dan Firman Muharram Syach (kelas Junior Bantam weight).
“Alhamdulillah KOBI berhasil mengukir sejarah lagi sebagai organiasi MMA pertama yang mengirimkan atlet MMA amatir nasional berlaga di kejuaraan MMA amatir dunia. Semoga kita dapat mengharumkan nama bangsa di kejuaraan MMA amatir dunia “2019 IMMAF – WMMAA Unified World Championships Amateur MMA,”ujar Ardi Bakrie, menambahkan.
Sebanyak 29 kelas akan dipertandingan, yang terdiri dari enam kelas senior wanita, 10 kelas senior pria, tiga kelas junior wanita dan 9 kelas junior pria. Nantinya lima atlet MMA Indonesia yang terpilih akan bersaing dengan ratusan atlet yang berasal dari berbagai negara.
Berdasarkan informasi dari pihak IMMAF, sebanyak 339 orang atlet senior dan 125 atlet junior sudah mendaftar untuk mengikuti kejuaaran, ratusan atlet MMA tersebut berasal dari 49 negara.
text:
Indonesia Joins the 2019 MMA Amateur World Championship in Bahrain
06 Nov 2019, 16:30 by Tempo.co, Ariandono
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Successfully overshadowed Indonesia's largest National MMA match, the One Pride MMA since 2016, now the Indonesian Martial Arts Committee (KOBI) is increasingly expanding its wings.
This month, KOBI will send the MMA Indonesian amateur athletes national team to compete in the world amateur MMA championship "2019 IMMAF - WMMAA Unified World Championships Amateur MMA".
The championship will take place November 11-16, 2019 at Khalifa Sport City, Isa Town, Manama, Bahrain.
The world amateur MMA Championship is organized by the International Mixed Martial Arts Federation (IMMAF). IMMAF is the first and only amateur MMA federation in the world founded in Stockholm, Sweden on February 29, 2012.
Furthermore, KOBI as an active member and representative of IMMAF in Indonesia, to note that in each country there is only one federation registered with IMMAF.
On June 23, 2019 KOBI conducted a national selection process for MMA athletes in the amateur athletes category at the Elite Club Epicentrum Jakarta. As many as 20 MMA athletes from several large centers under the auspices of KOBI throughout Indonesia participated in this national selection process.
From the selection process selected 10 best MMA athletes who have been given a briefing in the National MMA Training Center at Bali MMA Academy for three months from August 2019 to October 2019.
"KOBI sent five of the best National amateur athletes to take part in the world amateur MMA championship in Bahrain. This is in line with one of KOBI's missions, which is to work together with the International MMA organization to show the greatness of the Indonesian fighters, "said Ardi Bakrie, Chair of the KOBI.
After going through the National MMA Training Center, KOBI has chosen five quality athletes to be dispatched to take part in the world amateur MMA championship in Bahrain. The five athletes are Budi Setiawan (Senior Fly weight class), Rendi Anjar Kusuma (Senior Bantam weight class), Edi Erlangga (Senior Bantam weight class), Toby Prasetya (Junior Light weight class) and Firman Muharram Syach (Junior Bantam weight class) .
"Thank God KOBI succeeded in making history again as the first MMA organization to send national amateur MMA athletes competing in the world amateur MMA championship. Hopefully we can bring the name of the nation to the amateur world MMA championship "2019 IMMAF - WMMAA Unified World Championships Amateur MMA," said Ardi Bakrie, adding.
A total of 29 classes will be competed, consisting of six senior female classes, 10 senior male classes, three female junior classes and 9 male junior classes. Later, five selected Indonesian MMA athletes will compete with hundreds of athletes from various countries.
Based on information from the IMMAF, as many as 339 senior athletes and 125 junior athletes have registered to participate in the competition, hundreds of MMA athletes came from 49 countries.
